Fields.DialogueText: Hm... What do you think, Kapitan?
What? About the way you've set this gaming room up? I kind of like it. It feels like home.
Right? I feel as though it'll enrich the crew. I think I would perhaps give it a week, however, to see if it really catches on.
I'd say that's a fair assessment. By the way: have you been reading that book I gave you?
"Sherlock Holmes Arrives Too Late?" Kapitan, I had no idea you'd be cheeky enough to show me this! It's so flagrant the way Maurice LeBlanc flies in the face of Sir Arthur like that!

Fields.MenuText: If the shoe fits...
Lupin reminded me a lot of you, I had to.
Sherlock's not perfect!

Fields.DialogueText: Fu ha ha ha ha ha ha~! Come now, Kapitan. I may be a bit cheeky, but I have nowhere the charisma and charm as Lupin does. The fact that you say he reminds you of me, however, is... flattering.
What was it that seemed to reminiscent about Lupin that you thought of me? My charms, my elegant way of moving, my tricks? I don't think I'm as majestic as Lupin, but it's flattering you think so.
No, absolutely not! Being perfect has little to no charm, either. I believe Lupin is dashing, daring, and adventurous; he's willing to fail and be better. I... You've made me blush, Kapitan.
I wouldn't have flattered you so if I didn't think that was true, Orzel.
Ohoho! Here is my Kapitan, suddenly and openly saying something like this to me! Flirting with a submarine; you know how silly that sounds?
Call me a clown, then, because I mean it.
W-What!? Ohoho... Ehem! Kapitan, my goodness. (Why do I feel steam rising out of my collar?)
Oh, good morning, Kapitan, Miss Orzel. I wanted to tell you both there's some odd temperature readings in the boiler right this moment. It's really fluctuating.
Oho? I wonder why that is?
I can't make heads or tails of it. What about you, Miss Orzel? Are you feeling all right?
Oh! No, no, I'm quite fine, Andrzej.
Why is your face red, then? Do you mind if I check the boiler for any abnormalities?
I assure you, I'm f-fine!
She's just peachy today, Andrzej. Nothing to really worry about.
(They both look so embarrassed... Damn. Iwo told me it was a rumor, but... Hm...) All right. I'll head back and see to it myself. Thank you both.
Thank you, Andrzej. Also, please remember to knock when enter—Woah!
Kapitain! (*Huph!*) Got you!
Falling with style... Looks like we've got company.
I'll get everybody ready! Don't worry, Kapitan, you can count on us!
You all and Orzel both; let's take them out!
@BATTLE
Mmm! I'm quite glad we picked up recipes for the kitchen while we were in Denmark; these Frikadeller are so good!
I know, right? This Karbonader is fantastic, too.
With meals like these, its no wonder the whole crew is up and about like they're holding the world up! How riveting...
Good food can change a lot, you know? I've seen it happen plenty of times.
Have you now? Hm! I cannot deny its certainly giving me a better mood, even though I don't have to eat.
I'll say, you look so happy and at peace when you eat. Always taking time to enjoy and savor the flavor. Thorough as always, Orzel.
Hoho... If you enjoyed something so much, wouldn't it be right to savor the moment?

Fields.MenuText: Of course it is. I would.
Why wouldn't you?
If it means I can be here with you longer...

Fields.DialogueText: Fuhaha! That's such a straightforward answer, Kapitan. I wholeheartedly agree, though. Savor these moments that you get when the food is good and the company's better!
Perhaps people are just too prone to rushing? Think about it, Kapitan, not everyone would have the luxury of sitting down to eat—much less be in some lovely company! Cherish the moments!
W-Wah! Kaptain... You do know that there are other people here, too, right? ... I agree, though. Any moment that I get to spend in the company like this is a moment to savor...
I'll be certain to do so, and especially with you, Orzel.
Quit that, Kapitan! You'll spoil your and my appetite for dessert!
Well... Actually, what did they make today? I forgot.
I don't remember, either. Mayhaps we go ask? I wager it must be something in line with this danish we're having!
Wouldn't hurt to check.
Kapitan! Do you have a movement? I have some important data regarding movements of the Morganas toward Norway.
I don't think Norway's quite in our jurisdiction yet, Krystian. You've also caught at a busy time. Orzel and I were just about to have dessert.
Yes! We were wondering what they had made today, do you know?
No, I was about to go find out myself before I realized I had something to share with Kapitan. It's of the utmost importance.
Krystian, that sounds wonderful. However, could you please let the Kapitan and I have our dessert first? We'll be in much better spirits then!
(Orzel seems rather peppy... Has the Kapitan made her this way?) Hm. Well, I'd be remiss to disturb such a good time as dessert.
Oh, relax, Krystian - you can...
Orzel? Are you all right? You stopped mid sentence—
They're near. Come along, Kapitan! We need to get to the bridge right away!
W-Woah, hey! That's my arm! Slow it down a bit! Orzel!
(*Chuckle*) Ah. So that's what's going on, is it?
@BATTLE
Hm... Kapitan, your card is the five of hearts.
That's correct! Damn, Orzel, you're great at this.
It's all in the way you can look at the card from behind. Or is it?
Ah, another trick, huh? What did you do this time? Did you use your power to see behind me?
Not at all. In truth, it was the light behind you.
Of all the..! That's a nifty trick. Well done, Orzel.
Fuhuhuhu... Your eyes were gleaming so brightly, you thought you had me, didn't you?
Of course not, Orzel. As they say, "eagle eye," huh? Not that I'd want to escape you anytime soon.
You'd better be careful, Kapitan. You know that in those games of cards, I play for keeps! What kind of Belle would I be if I didn't have such vision?

Fields.MenuText: Even without it, you're still you.
What if I wasn't a Captain?
(Flash the Queen Of Hearts to Orzel.)

Fields.DialogueText: Ohoho... Kapitan, you said that with such confidence, look at you! Though, I appreciate it. You see me as me, and that's all I could ever ask for from a Kapitan. Well, and more chances for pictures...
As if that would change anything! Even if you weren't a Kapitan, I'd still respect and see you for you. I know you'd do the same for me; that, I can say with all of my heart. I know it to be true!
E-Ehm! (*Blush*) Oh my... Kapitan, that's rather daring for this time of day. (Oh, goodness, my heart's beating so fast!) But I understand, Kapitan. That makes me joyful to know you see me like that!
Of course, Orzel; to me, I see through the illusions and get out on the other side!
Suppose you don't want me to pull you out of a silk top hat like some kind of rabbit, do you?
Don't eagles eat rabbits?
Fuhuhuhu... That's a bit of a secret. Although, I cannot say that I've ever had rabbit. Only "welsh rabbits" but I don't think that counts.
Maybe on off time we could go to a café together? They've been building more of them within Belle range of the docks, I hear.
That sounds lovely! I hear there's some really good ones in Belfast. I believe I picked up some recipes for coffee.
Oh? Share them with the cooks if you can, maybe they can get it right?
I'd rather it be... between us, Kapitan.
Oh... Oh! Right, right.
Yes... No one to the left, no one to the right... Ergh. Why would you make me say it when the others can hear us!?
Oh, relax, they can't hear us—Owf! Maybe they can? That was a loud knock.
Ack! That wasn't a knock, that was a Morgana salvo! Come on, Kapitan, we need to move!
Right away! Although, I'm holding you to that cafe thing!
@BATTLE
Rather smooth this morning, wouldn't you say so, Kapitan?
Oh, good morning, Orzel. You wouldn't happen to be the cause of this smooth sailing, would you?
That's my job, Kapitan.
Speaking of, where are we headed?
Apparently, Stockholm. According to Krystian, we've been contacted directly by the Swedes.
Oh, that's right. There was a huge debacle over there involving Gnevny. I guess they'd like to talk with us?
If there's anyone who can talk with people, it is I. Not to worry, Kapitan. Whatever they have in store for us, I'll take care of it!

Fields.MenuText: I get to listen to you talk more? Sign me up.
I never had any doubt.
Don't suppose I can get a word in?

Fields.DialogueText: Fuhahaha! Don't you go getting me started, Kapitan. The next thing you'll know, I'll be having those in the meeting asking to join the crew! Do I need to get you a tape record, Kapitan?
Ohoho! Once again with the certainty, Kapitan. Perhaps I should teach you some of the finer points of conversation, then? Maybe I could observe you talking to them instead and write down notes?
Would you perhaps like to write our opening statements in response to them? Perhaps an official introduction is in order? I'd love to write with you, Kapitan. I could show you some skills, too!
Well, if there's anyone who I'd like to learn negotiation and talking from, it's you, Orzel.
I wouldn't mind giving you a crash course at all. Feel free to call me into your office at any time!
(*Pfpht!*) What? Ma'am? You have any idea what you just said?
What do you mean, Iwo? That didn't have any other meaning behind it. I was simply going to educate the Kapitan on the finer points of talking.
The way you said it was kind of...
While it was kind of low, I can assure you, Iwo, that's just Orzel.
All right... (Then, why the hell are you blushing, Kaptain?)
Either way. Hopefully we reach Stockholm in not too long time. Have our friends at the League already been made aware?
They have! They're very eager to see what Sweden would like.
I'm willing to guess that it has something to do with eliminating Morganas. I think we've left Sweden feeling a bit neglected over the last few weeks.
We'll see to it. For now, though, I'd say its about time we break for lunch. Wouldn't you agree, Kapitan?
Of course—
Hold the phone, you two! We've got Morganas up ahead! They haven't spotted us yet, but they're roaming about!
All right, then! All hands! Let's finish this up quickly!
We'll get them so fast that they won't even know what did them in!
(Those two...)
@BATTLE
You must be Konteramiral Jarl, yes? We are pleased to make your acquaintance.
As am I. I have heard a great deal of things about you and your Captain, Orzel.
I hope those are good things, Konteramiral.
They are - and they were reinforced by how you dealt with the Morganas blocking our port yesterday. Good things to come, I'm hoping.
Speaking of which; the Royal Navy said that you were interested in my crew and I specifically.
Correct. As you no doubt know, we're... sensitive to INPF politicking after that business with that Soviet rabble-rouser. It left some scars.
I have heard many reports about Gnevny's conduct and on behalf of the INPF, I would like to extend a formal apology.
It is in the past, but the past is not so easily forgotten. That being said; Sverige is willing to forgo that in favor of a new opportunity. Simply put: we need help regarding the Morganas.
Consulting? Or more general types of defense?
Putting it bluntly, we need defensive help. Despite our own forces being extremely well-handled, these Morganas are on another level.
Do not worry. The Kapitan and I are a wonderful team; if you give as an objective, it will be done proper.

Fields.MenuText: Your expectations are our expectations.
Hand in hand with Orzel, we're quite the team.
Nothing escapes our eagle eyes.

Fields.DialogueText: I am firm in my assertion that both the Kapitan and I work incredibly well together and can follow to the letter should we choose to do so. Of course, if that's not your thing, we can do whichever.

(Oh... Kapitan! Why say that here now of all places!? You'll make me red in the face!) That's right. You've most likely seen submarines before, Rear Admiral, but you've yet to see a duo quite like us.
Any Morgana that comes in our vision, we'll be upon them. We may not be a cruiser, but we lack in that big size we make up for with speed, accuracy, passion, and grit; all of that, together!
Well now... I wasn't expecting such confidence at all! So this is the Orzel that outwitted the Kriegsmarine into doing her work for her?
I cannot take all the credit for it. My crew and Kapitan helped me finalize and enact the plan. It is with their help that it worked so well.
(Wow... She's glowing!)
Well, then. If you would be so kind as to correspond with my team here in Stockholm, we'd be happy to provide support however we can.
Absolutely. What about you, Orzel? Ah. You went quiet again, are you all right?
I can sense them, the Morganas are coming, Kapitan.
Right, let's head to the bridge. Forgive me, Admiral; these things always show up at the worst times.
Bry dig inte. Besides. I'm curious to see what a refined Belle and a Captain are capable of. That is, if you're all right with that?
Of course! The Kapitan and I know just how to put on a great show.
@BATTLE
I cannot help but feel like the Rear Admiral left out a few key details about our objective. Either that, or he simply didn't know.
I think that may have been a case of not been knowing, Jarl seems like more of the "I have to see it" type. That's what I got from him.
Hm. What do you suggest we do about these clusters then, Kapitan? I'm open to suggestions.
I think we should begin by showing the Morganas we mean business. We put on a real flashy display at the strait, but we need something dynamic and hard hitting here.
A bit of guile will show those sea witches what for! You're thinking like me now, Kapitan.

Fields.MenuText: Well, when I'm around you I feel special.
So when do I get the feathers?
Maybe you're thinking like me?

Fields.DialogueText: ... More confident, too. Interesting, Kapitan. It looks like I'll have to keep a closer eye on you than before. Though, perhaps you'd like that a bit too much?
Would you like me to make you some, Kapitan? I feel you'd get up to all kinds of mischief with them if I did; what if I'm held responsible for that? Hmm... Maybe you'd like to bail me out?
I could be. Perhaps you've rubbed off on me for so much that we've begun to be more like each other? We might just have to sit down together and talk for an hour alone, hm? Perhaps delve deeper?
I think I'd like that. But it'd go doubly so if I get to be with you, Orzel.
Hoho... What's gotten into you, Kapitan? You've been a bit more flirtatious lately.
I think you're rubbing off on me a bit. That and...
You don't have any excuses at all, don't you? Fuhuhuhuhuhuh...
Got me there. Anyway, how do you wager we enter? I was thinking we could talk to Iwo about routes.
Iwo's been looking at me oddly lately.
Same with me regarding Krystian. Do you think they want to tell us something?
I've always told them to be open with me. Maybe we should all get together and do something during downtime?
That sounds nice. Are you thinking we should host a game night again?
Maybe... Oh, what about we just shares a few drinks while at port? I know most people like to drink.
Ah, but, Krystian's a teetotaler. Also, I don't think we should be drinking alcohol while on duty. I'm pretty sure that's a violation.
Got me there... Right, let's run over this one more time. There's a cluster here at Oxelösund and another at Nynäshamn which is closer. I think we should hit up Nynäshamn first.
Right. If we're closer to Stockholm, that means we have more of a chance at really taking those Morganas by surprise. They've had resistance from the Swedes, but not resistance like ours.
Oho! No they haven't. This is where we get to shine, Kapitan. Gnevny may have made an impression, but we'll make it lasting.
That's what I like to hear. Let's move it on out and catch them by their ghostly tails!
Yeah! ... Wait, do they even have tails?
@BATTLE
What have you got there, Kapitan?
Oh, these? The locals were so happy with us coming in and showing those Morganas up that they wanted to reward us. These are pastries.
Fuhahaha! How amazing! It's almost as if they didn't have any help before we came in...
I think they had help, I just think that the Svenska Marinen were overtaxed. Couple that with Gnevny's previous blunder, and well...
Poor Gnevny... I'll bet that girl is still beating herself up about it, too.
Well, it was a call that was made in the moment. I can't speak on whether Gnevny thought about the ramifications or not, moreso that she just did it.
What if I did something like that, Kapitan?

Fields.MenuText: I would ask you to talk to me first.
I know you better than that, Orzel.
You have a consicence, Orzel.

Fields.DialogueText: Would you? Ah... If I must confess, that makes me really happy! It's in those difficult decisions I find than you can really figure out someone's true colors. Perhaps you'll see mine?
Fuhahaha! Do you now? Maybe there's things behind my illusions that lead to further illusions. I say that... but I know you're the type of person to brave illusion and find the truth; just like me.
Gnevny had a conscience, too, Kapitan. All Belles do. I appreciate the sentiment, nonetheless; your trust in me feels warm... It shows that there's still things we both are learning about each other.
How many cards must I pick before you show me the right one, Orzel? Or, maybe that's up your sleeve?
There's a certain chance to the draw, Kapitan. Imagine it like these pastries; they're in unmarked brown bags, so you'll only know what you'll get when you open it.
I have enough trust in the bag that should I open it, there will be pastry inside. I think that's what the most important thing about it is. It's about trust.
Hm... When your eyes lie, your heart will tell the truth? I don't think I've told you that one yet, have I?
No. That's a good one, and it makes a lot of sense, too.
Of course, Kapitan. It's all in the heart and mind; master them together, and you'll see things you never thought could be.
I didn't think I'd ever meet somebody like you, Orzel.
Fuhahaha! Well look no further, because I'm right here! Oh... Is this a turnover?
I think it is. I got a donut earlier; had a nice few stripes on it. I didn't know they made donuts here.
Guess I'll just have to try my luck. (*Munch!*) Oh... By god, that's flaky and chewy, and... Ohohoho~ Kapitan, you wouldn't happen to know who sent us these, did you?
I think a local confectionaries company. I take it that's you wanting me to get the recipe for "military purposes?"
Now -that's- how I know that you know me well, Kapitan.
We might have to do that later, though. I can see a few ships on the horizon, and they don't look like any destroyers or cruisers I've ever seen.
Of all the times... Oh well, they're lucky I just had some great turnover. (*Crick-crack!*) I'm still not going to go easy on them.
Neither am I. Let's get them!
@BATTLE
I never thought we'd get caught on deck in the midst of a firefight!
It's certainly a jam! I don't think I've ever been this close to danger!
Fuhahaha! Nonsense, Kapitan. If this is danger, then we're no worse off for participating in it. This is nothing!
... You dodged that salvo like it was nothing.
Care to dance, Kapitan?
I don't think this is really the time—
Nonsense, come with me!
Woah!
@BATTLE
Hah! Shocked and awed. There goes another cluster of Morganas... Are you all right, Kapitan?

Fields.MenuText: I think there's a few holes in my jacket.
(*Nauseated Groan*)
Felt like I was surfing.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh dear! I'll make sure those are sewn up right away. Ah... I'm sorry, Kapitan. Urgh! Even though you did so well, I should've asked you if you would've been ok with this first. There I go again...
Oh! Oh! Here, take my shoulder. Goodness me, I wish you could have seen the way you moved. You were wonderful, Kapitan, really. I'm sorry for not asking you first; that is my fault.
I didn't know you were into that kind of thing, Kapitan! I should try that myself sometime... Ack! I'm sorry for not getting your permission; I was thinking on my feet, and I wasn't thiking..
Orzel, don't you worry. In this situation, you thought quickly, and did that to protect me. That's all I could ask for.
It still doesn't make it right, Kapitan. You and I both know that!
Of course we do, but I chose to go along with it. I could've just as easily dropped down to the deck, but I put my trust in you, Orzel.
K-Kaptain...
It's ok, Orzel. I'm still here. I'm just a little fuzzy in the head.
I've heard that actor Errol Flynn is kind of famous for these situations, isn't he?
Maybe we should watch a movie at some point? Sounds like a nice...  (*Hurk!*)
Kaptain... Ergh. Even when we're out in a firefight, you're still—
Hey! I don't need to be the one to tell either of you this, but get the HELL back inside! We need to submerge and take the rest of them out!
Iwo! Ack, right! Hold onto me, Kapitan. I'll be right in!
I hope they have something for nausea...
Those Morganas have started to scatter more... We must be really getting to them.
Hm...
Oh, Kapitan! I didn't know you liked to read while on the bridge?
Not much else is happening as of this moment, and I thought I'd read a couple short stories.
I think I know that one! Isn't that the "Free Lines Of Old French?" I think that's by an American author, no?
Indeed it is. Abraham Merritt wrote this along with this compilation. I got it as part of a wider book exchange with the Belles. I heard the USS Lexington is a big champion for it.
Is that right? I'll have to write her sometime. I wonder if she'd like any of my books? I have some extra copies I could share.

Fields.MenuText: Lovecraft seems like kind of a big step up...
Maybe some Doyle?
Sienkiewicz sounds good.

Fields.DialogueText: I also happen to know some of the girls are a bit religious. I don't want to offend them by accident! Imagine what we'd get in trade of Lovecraft, though! Maybe some Kafka? I've heard he's popular...
I'm pretty sure some of the more of the brain-teasing Belles might like that. I'm kind of curious about this "Dick Tracy" I hear about sometimes. Doyle may give us some interesting results overall!
Oho! And here I thought you wouldn't have suggested something from home! I wonder if there are any of his other works floating about; what if we got our hands on some of them? That'd be a treat!
I wonder if any of them would like some Maurice Leblanc?
As much as I -love- Lupin, I'm not sure who'd enjoy literature about a "petty thief." I hate that some call Lupin that, he's not!
I think there's one Belle that may appreciate it. I've heard about her recently, she's been making a name for herself.
That wouldn't happen to be that Italian one, would it? The one with the handcuffs?
You asked about that specifically! What, do you think you could break out of them if she caught you?
If Houdini can escape six pairs, I can escape one without too much trouble. I don't intend to earn her ire, though.
I don't think anyone would want to earn your ire, Orzel. Least of all me.
You don't have to worry about that, Kapitan. The only thing you've earned is my attention.
I hope to earn a lot more than that... By the way, how are we doing on time? I heard Norrköping's in trouble.
We should be there in about an hour or so based on estimates. That being said, I am detecting some bumps in the road ahead.
Well, I guess I can finish this later. All right, everyone, battlestations.
It's a good ending with an important message, Kapitan.
And what would that be, Orzel?
Trust not what you're told outright, but what you know in your heart is true.
(Somehow... I feel happier.)
@BATTLE
Kapitan, is it just me, or have you noticed the crew has been acting strangely lately?
What do you mean?
I mean they've often gone quiet when we're talking with each other. I was wondering if they were worried about me at first, but...
Come to think of it, they've done the same thing with me, too. Mayhaps we should ask them about it?
Definitely. But, why would they even do something like that? I don't even think we did anything wrong, did we?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe it's the books?
Iwo said he gets odd looks, too.
Seems like it could be a coincidence.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't think I've heard any complaints about those. I know Krystian and Iwo have had heated arguments about some German literature before, but not anything substantial...
I've talked to some of the crew about that. I've urged him to take on a softer tone; he's told me it's because that's how he shows his respect. It still makes some people upset, so...
Andrzej, Krystian, and Iwo seem to do it a lot. That's why I brought it up to you, Kapitan. Despite that, it could be a coincidence in the end; still, for it to happen this much...
Odd... I say for now we reiterate to them that we're open to talk. If it keeps happening after that, we may need to really do something on it.
You're not too worried about this, Kapitan?
Why should I worry? They're our crew, and I trust them.
I trust them, but I also know myself, and you know me; when someone's got something to say or is thinking about another person, they stare.
Maybe I should stare at you more often, huh?
(*Sigh*) I walked right into that one, didn't I?
I guess I cast an illusion.
Fuhahaha! The only thing illusionary here is your bravado, Kapitan. Even so, thank you for saying that...
I wouldn't say it if I didn't mean it. Now, let's get back to reading; I was given this yesterday.
Hm... "Who Goes There?" Why, I go there, of course. But, I'd at least be sure to knock!
This is supposedly a really good, if at all scary novel.
Hm... Oh! Skimming a bit, I think I've got some ideas for the future...
I hope none of those involve you eating us.
Oh, Kapitan... I'd eat you first, how about that?
Well, I—Oh. There goes the sea again. It's getting really choppy now, huh?
Great... They always have such poor timing. I was about to start reading what I got, too. Maybe later when I'm alone... (Emily Bronte, show me how to love!)
What did you get?
That's a secret~
@BATTLE
Hm... See if you can get through this, Kapitan.
Oh? Placing your rooks like that? Hm...
That and a lot more ways to find yourself trapped; caught in my talons...

Fields.MenuText: Maybe that's where I'd like to be?
You say that like you haven't lost one bishop.
Oh no! Whatever shall I do!?

Fields.DialogueText: (What in the!?) Hoho... You've really been thinking like me, haven't you, Kapitan? Sly dog... But it'll take a lot more than that to break my concentration on you! Come on, make a move!
Haven't I told you to think of the bigger picture, Kapitan? One bishop lost could be two of your knights gained. It's all a matter of perspective. Focus now, would you? What's wrong? Scared to move?
You may laugh as much as you wish, Kapitan, but I hold the power here. If you feel so inclined as to test my words, you may move forward. I advise you, however, to be careful... My beak is sharp.
I'll make my move in good time, Orzel. I have thirty seconds, I'll think on it.
Perhaps you'd prefer to think about me?
I can't go off thinking about you alone, now can I? (*Clack!*)
Ah. There goes my rook... and here goes your bishop! (*Clack!*)
(*Shuuuuuup!*) Check.
Ah! ... Fuhuhu... Fuhahahahahahahaha! Ahahahahahahaha! Kapitan! How marvelous!
You told me once to not trust only the eyes, but to instead listen to the heart as well, didn't you?
All senses, Kapitan, all parts. (*Gururururu... Clack!*) Who's in check now?
Both of us. Look at the board.
(N-No way! How did Kapitan...?) Hmhm! Looks like it's a stalemate... Goodness, Kapitan, you caught on rather quickly!
I'm lucky I have a teacher who knows the board better than I do. Most of that was just touch and go.
Don't you worry, Kapitan. I'll get you to a point where you can go beyond touch and go! Soon, it'll become second nature!
I appreciate your confidence in me, Orzel. Thank you for a wonderful round. And... thank you for being with me.
Oh, Kapitan, just seeing you like this is—
Orzel! Kapitan! I apologize for barging in, but we have an incredibly bad situation!
Krystian! What's going on!?
It's a distress call from Gothenburg! Morganas have breached the defenses! Ackran and Tynnered are on fire!
They need our help, right away! Orzel, come with me! Krystian, round up everyone and get to the bridge!
Yes, Kapitan!
Seems like they tried to be flashy, too? I have news for them... It's not about who's the flashiest; it's about who captivates!
We'll give them a hell of a show, then!
@BATTLE
They really did it this time, didn't they? Look at all the smoke...
If they wanted our attention, they certainly got it.
How should we approach this? Everywhere is on fire...
Civilians are our top priority. We should try to divert them somewhere safe.
Indeed... I think I have an idea if you'd like to listen, Kapitan?
Tell me, I'm all ears.
If we run to the place that's most populated, defend it from there, and then head to a place sparsely populated while making a big scene, we should be able to divert them.
While I like that plan, I feel it has a major flaw. If we put these citizens in jeopardy, we'd be going right back to what Gnevny did.
But, Kapitan, if we don't reach them in time, their chances of survival are little! Don't you know what Morganas do to humans?
I'm well aware, but there's got to be a way to do this that doesn't directly endanger a large part of the population.
Kapitan... I don't think I've ever encountered something like this before.

Fields.MenuText: It's all right, Orzel; I've got your back.
No matter what we do, it's you and me.
Trust your heart, not your eyes.

Fields.DialogueText: Kapitan... Could we have come earlier, this wouldn't have all ended up happening. And I know you've always had my back... I simply look upon and I feel afraid. I'm afraid of what could happen.
(*Sigh*) Kapitan... When you say such things, I can't help but feel... warmth. It's a warmth that even shatters the cruel nature of these flames. Despite all of that, I still have... fear.
Hah... Only you would throw my own words back at me, only you! What is it with you!? Ah, but, that... I'm sorry, Kapitan. My hands and legs are still quivering, what I see before me is... terrifying.
I won't put you down, Orzel. What we did at Denmark's a lot different than this, but I want you to know: I'm scared, too.
You are?
Of course I am. Fear's a real, material emotion that manifests in the mind in the event of unknown. Lovecraft knew that better than anyone. Now, however, we are here. Fear is our adversary...
But it doesn't rule us, nor is it truly itself.
Well, look at you... Now you're talking like me, too!
Of course I would, Orzel. We're ship and captain.
... (I want it to be more. Now isn't the right time to say it, but...)
That all said, Orzel, here is my idea: first things first, we deal with that back up squadron of Morganas up ahead. Then, we block the rest from going in.
Cutting off their reinforcements... I like that idea, Kapitan! Novel, and it seems we can go a lot of places from there!
Of course, I'll be relying on you to fill in the pieces as we go. Are you ready?
I write with a quill pen, don't you know? And yes, Kapitan. Together, we'll show these Morganas what happens to those that get too far ahead of themselves!
@BATTLE
Not so tough when you don't have friends, aren't you?
I think we drove around that Morgana so fast I have whiplash...
I've been to Wisconsin, Cap. This is nothing.
They have Morganas in Wisconsin?
No, but if they did, we'd trounce them all the same. It looks like we've gotten their attention.
All right, Orzel. Any ideas?
Hm... I think I'm noticing something, but I can't quite be too sure about it. Can we move further into the canal, Kapitan? Not too far into civilians, but just far enough...
I trust you, Orzel. Whatever you've got planned, I have faith in it.
Kapitan... All right! Come along, everyone! You'll need to help out in this, too! Battle stations!
@BATTLE
Hah! I -knew- it!
Those Morganas seemed to be quite routed in that battle, it's almost like they couldn't formulate a counterattack...
Of course they can't, Kapitan! Thanks to the combination of the flames and Andrzej's "Rainmakers," they can't even see straight!

Fields.MenuText: They're still so human...
No wonder they seemed so confused...
Excellent thinking, Orzel.

Fields.DialogueText: Aren't they, though? For all their ghostly wrath and shifting spirits, they aren't immune to the laws that bind us! Ah... Kapitan, thank you for earlier; if we hadn't waited, this could've gone worse!
That big one in the back looks like she just got the wrong end of a camera flash; that was priceless. I have you to thank for putting us in this situation, Kapitan. This is going swimmingly!
I can't take all of the credit for it, Kapitan. You and the crew made this completely possible. Thanks to your advice, this ended up a lot better than I thought it would.
Likewise, I can't take all the credit for it either, Orzel; it was you and the crew who thought this far ahead with what was set up.
Andrzej said it would work and thanks to Krystian giving an approximate measurement of the canal, Iwo was able to maneuver in such a way that it used the flames to our advantage!
Time to give these Morganas a real lightshow. We're nowhere near down here yet.
I haven't been able to show the biggest trick yet, either.
Perhaps I could act as an assistant?
Why... I'd love that.
To think, they've already lit this much ablaze... Why did they attack this place, anyway?
Might have been under defended for all we know. From what I gather, we've bought people enough time to get underground or away.
That reminds me: where the hell's the Marinen?
Perhaps they're being held up... Oh well! That leaves more time for us to really give it to this lot.
Speaking of, what's your big trick you've got planned, Orzel?
It's going to take some gumption, but! I think I've got an idea, and I'm open to feedback on it!
Don't leave me in suspense now...
"(whispered)" (Good God, look at the Kapitan...)
"(whispered)" (I knew something was going on, but this is something else... It's like they're made for each other!)
"(whispered)" (I haven't seen Orzel that devious in a while; those two are practically a fountain of ideas... What do you think we should do?)
"(whispered)" (I think we should help Miss Orzel. Even though she's pumped up, I can tell she's holding back...)
"(whispered)" (They ought to be real with each other... Hm. I'll talk to Krystian. Right now, let's see what ma'am's got to say.) All ears down here, too.
Ready when you are, Miss Orzel!
All right... It goes like this: we take out the next batch, and then we hide as deep down as we can go. Then, when they think we're gone, we surface as fast as we can...
Surfacing that fast would be a lost of stress on the crew, but I can see what it is; that'd create an uneven current, which would cause a gigantic ripple when you surface if you use your ability.
Precisely. Although, you're right about the crew. What should we do?
We surface slowly... But when we're about 30 seconds away from surfacing, we amp up the speed; that way, it'll create the wave, but it won't pressure the crew.
I... trust you, Kapitan.

Fields.MenuText: And I'm glad to have that trust.
A fighting crew's a great crew.
We've got them, we just need to be careful.

Fields.DialogueText: As am I, Kapitan. You always humor my ideas and hear me out... Even if my heart's in the right place, I'm glad you give me a second opinion.
Of course, Kapitan. Here around me are the people I treasure. I'd be sooner wingless than hurt any of them. L-Least of all, you.
I wasn't thinking like that before... Thank you for bringing me back; I got so blind to the call of victory that I would've almost done something reckless. You're right, Kapitan, we're so close...
Of course, Orzel. Now, let's get these clowns good.
There are now clowns here, Kapitan. It's only "magic." And we're about to make that magic happen!
@BATTLE
Morning's almost here, and now they're running away!
I think they might be bringing more. We've bought enough time that people are starting to put out the fire.
And once this is over, we can help them... We just need that one, final blow.
I think we're about to get it. Look on ahead!
That's a big Morgana... Big deal! We've gone through one, we'll go through more; let's get at her!
Time to raise the curtain...
Ladies and gents! It's showtime!
@BATTLE
No encore? Hmph! I'm rather disappointed in these Morganas. They're kind of a scattered crowd...

Fields.MenuText: They were so shocked, they fled.
Too bad they didn't stick around...
Aw, I was about to show what was in the box!

Fields.DialogueText: To be fair, I did pull out my best work. I think Iwo put the fear of god in them when he started revving the engine. That made me laugh so hard...
I wish they would have. They didn't know what I had in store for them; tell me Kapitan, have you ever heard of the famous "water trap"? Houdini was famous for it...
The box? Fuhahaha! Kapitan, did the townspeople send some surprise ordinance? You could get in a lot of trouble for that... but, I think I'd like to see that eventually.
I don't think I've ever had this much fun in battle before.
Well, Kapitan, it's because you don't let yourself have fun with it at all. I'm not saying to forget the crew, the objective, or heaven forbid the civilians... But that's not all it is!
No it isn't... I just worry about all of you, still.
And I'm glad you do, Kapitan. That being said, you've got to let yourself have some freedom and fun with it; you've got a crew, but you need that creativity and imagination!
I think you captured a little bit of it with that water dove trick you pulled. That was lovely to see.
Y-You think so? Ahaha... I will admit, I came up with the idea after reading some of Lupin's exploits; it seemed like something he would've done and...
It was beautiful, Orzel. Could you show that to me some other time, too?
Of course, Kapitan... I'd love to.
I'll be looking forward to it! Oh... Morning's here, huh?
That's a beautiful sunrise...
Indeed it is. Ah... Orzel? You're on my arm.
Shh... Just... Just let me be here a while, please?
Orzel... All right. But no more than fifteen minutes, ok? We have to help the people.
Of course, Kapitan... (*Sigh*) Thank you, thank you so much.
I didn't think that fire was that bad until I got to see it up close... Ergh. If only we had gotten here earlier!
You can't beat yourself up for that, Orzel. We had no way of knowing. Krystian only caught it at the last minute.
Seeing this... Hm. I know I shouldn't, Kapitan, but it still makes me quite sad.
I agree. This does not fill me with joy, but what does is helping these people get back on their feet. Pass me that crate, would you?
Huph! It's rather heavy... What is this one labeled? "Supplies?"
That's for building repair. Place that over by the other materials. I believe a building team is supposed to come by this afternoon.
They're going to rebuild it? Just like that? What about the dangers of guns and warfare?
Sweden's neutral, remember?
Oh right... Hm. That reminds me: did we ever hear from our Rear Admiral about the hold up?
He apologized profusely and said that they were indeed held up by a Morgana contingent. They did, however, manage to get by with our advice.
Just like me with you; it's so nice to have another person who thinks on the same mind as you.

Fields.MenuText: Two heads are better than one!
I challenge you—keep you guessing!
You're still you, Orzel.

Fields.DialogueText: I know I am! It's just great to have someone that... gets me, you know? Someone that I can rely on, but who also relies on me, and is always pushing me to do more and think differently...
And that's what makes you so great to me; you push me to think in ways I didn't think were possible. I'm already a bit creative, but it's when I'm with you that it really comes out in full force!
And I can't imagine a better head to add to the duality than yours, Kapitan. There's something about the way that our minds meld that creates these sparks... I don't know how to put it... Electric?
Maybe it's just how I am... or how you've grown on me! But the feeling's mutual.
I'm so glad... Hm? Is it me, or are there fish in this crate?
Oh! That was one we pulled out of the bay earlier today; supposedly, people working at the dock nearby just dropped it and ran.
Well, that's too bad. It looks like quite the haul! Where should we leave it?
Over there... Oh. Great.
W-What? How can there still be more Morganas? Didn't they learn their lesson yesterday?
Evidently not. Are you up for a repeat performance?
Hmmmm... Oh, all right; just this once~
@BATTLE
Ah! Still reading "Who Goes There?"
Oh! Hello, Orzel. Yes, I am. I just got to a rather good part, too. This book is suspenseful, but I think it also plays on a common thing in human nature.
Given what I'd know about the novella... That'd be human trust, right?
That's right! And it's done quite well.
I think that's what interests me about it most, about how easily they fall for... whatever it is. Why do you think that's so, Kapitan?

Fields.MenuText: Well... It can mimic -anything-.
Distrust.
It's tough to say...

Fields.DialogueText: True: how are you supposed to trust anything, much less people. At the same time, outwitting the creature can't be impossible; ingenuity appears during fear, too, no?
Of course! Trust in the people you know is gone when that creature can become anyone, much less any animal or even living thing it comes across... Of course, desperate times call for equal measures.
Perhaps there's multiple reasons; trust is one, but there's also the idea of doubt; what if no one survives? What if that thing knows exactly what they're thinking? That's when innovation comes...
Fear's and the prospect of facing something unknown and dangerous is difficult. At a time like that, keeping cool is paramount.
How can you keep cool in a situation like that, I wonder? Especially considering that the people you've known, the people you trust could suddenly be...
That's what scares you the most, isn't it?
Doesn't it scare you?
Of course it does. At a time like that, though, you've got to think about what you know is true. The best thing you can do for those you value is to find the truth; they'd want you to survive.
To hold on to that love, even though they could be dead...
Love transcends that, Orzel. In a situation as messed up as that, if you can survive and live for those who gave their lives...
I understand, Kapitan... Just, if anything happened to you, I...
It's all right, Orzel. I have no intention of leaving any time soon; what's proposed in "Who Goes There?" is a hypothetical situation.
You'd best not! But... I want you to promise me something, Kapitan.
And what would that be?
If there's ever something wrong and you feel as though you can't tell anyone else about it; please, tell me. I'd do the same for you, Kapitan. Please, promise me that.
I promise you, Orzel. I will. The eyes may lie, but the heart tells the truth.
Kapitan...
I... Hm? Did it just get colder?
"Who goes there!?"
"It must be a peaceable thing, in its own—inimitable—way." Tsk. Tsk. Tsk.
@BATTLE
Well, that's it for Gothenburg. Where to next?
According to some messages from the Marinen, Malmö. They're worried about an increased presence of Morganas there.
Malmö... That's very close to Polish and German waters; isn't the Kriegsmarine doing anything about them?

Fields.MenuText: I'd imagine they have their hands full.
I think they're waiting for Sweden to be humbled enough to ask.
And let them hog the glory?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh that's right... Sometimes, I forget those sea witches aren't exclusive to any one body of water. Still, they're about a spits distance away from Sweden...
Damn, that makes me feel bad for Sweden...
Fuhahahahaha! I think not! All right, then; if they aren't going to be the ones to help Sweden, I'd gladly step up to do so instead! I'll show them; we won't abandon Sweden!
Being neutral seems to have its benefits, but it also leaves you open to a lot more harassment.
That seems to be a commonality. It's like trying to play chess with three players, but the third color doesn't move or act until acted upon.
It's just another facet of war, really.
Hah... You people and your idiosyncrasies! Regardless, it's about high time we get moving.
I agree. According to Jarl's report, they should be happy to see us there. People in Gottenburg are already chanting "OrzeL" apparently.
T-They are?
Didn't you hear it this morning? It was so loud I couldn't get a wink of sleep. You deserve it, Orzel.
But I wasn't the only one who did things...
Of course not. That doesn't mean, however, that you don't deserve praise all the same.
Ack... Kaptain, I'm not used to this...
I'd imagine not; after all, you don't like that kind of thing, do you?
No, it's not that I hate praise... I just don't want you all to go without the respect you deserve, too. You all make me, treasure me, and value me for who I am...
If nobody else says it, I know that, too. And I know that their praise of you isn't unwarranted, Orzel. For every magician there is, there are assistants who are just as important. We believe in you.
Kapitan... Thank you.
I know that much is true, Orzel. Oh. Speaking of which, I think I see some guests up ahead. You want to go entertain them together?
With you? Of course I would! I've been working on that water bird trick. I thought I'd show you!
Now that... That, I have to get a front row seat for!
@BATTLE
"(whispered)" (So... Are we all in agreement as to what we're seeing?)
"(whispered)" (I mean, shit reminds me of when I saw Sinatra perform. They've got some real hearts in their eyes...)
"(whispered)" (You've seen Sinatra? I've heard about him. How is he?)
"(whispered)" (Krystian, we should focus on the task at hand here... How do we get the Kapitan and Orzel to, you know?)
"(whispered)" (Right, right... Hm. What if we closed out this operation, and then gave them some time alone?)
"(whispered)" (Could we really just do that? I mean, isn't it against regulations to abandon ship when not at home base?)
"(whispered)" (That's a good point... Actually, where do you think we'll end up when we get back?)
"(whispered)" (My bets are on Stockholm. I'll bet that Jarl will want to congratulate us.)
"(whispered)" (All right, we'll plan around that. For now, act like you don't know anything regarding their relationship.)
"(whispered)" (You got me.)
"(whispered)" (Me, too!)
So... what do you make of the new plans?
I think they're great for what we've got going, Kapitan. Though, what do you make of the situation in Malmö currently?
I think it can be improved. More importantly, I think if we clinch this out, we'll be even better in Denmark and Sweden's ledgers.
Always a bonus! Oh, by the way, Kapitan: I've been thinking about what we should do this afternoon... I managed to pick up something while we were at the docks!

Fields.MenuText: Don't make me guess, Orzel...
Those were a -lot- of crates.
Does it involve coffee?

Fields.DialogueText: Come now, Kapitan! Guessing is half the fun of it! That way, I can keep you guessing, and chomping at the bit... After all, you don't reveal your greatest until the end; the very end!
You saw those, eh? I will admit, I was very happy to receive such a thing from the locals. I'll bet that makes you even more curious, doesn't it, Kapitan? You must be itching to know what's inside...
Well, I... Actually, it kind of smells like that. It isn't what you're thinking, however! Trust me, Kapitan... The more you guess, the more excited you'll be when I finally reveal it!
It's always guessing with you, isn't it?
Would you believe me if I said I feel the same towards you, Kapitan?
I'd believe it. Sometimes, the decisions I end up making have me guessing at myself...
Fuhahahahaha! Now if that isn't a relatable sentiment, I'm unsure of what is!
Yeah, sometimes it keeps me awake—
Kapitan, Orzel. There are several energy signatures about 1500 meters away...
All right. Prepare for battle! But I'm holding you to that surprise, Orzel...
I should hope you do, Kapitan... I think you'll love it.
@BATTLE
All right, Kapitan... Now we get to do something truly fun.
And now I get to actually see what was inside these crates.
Well look no further, Kapitan... Tadaah!
Ingredients? Flour, sugar, eggs, milk... Now if I didn't know any better, we're going to be making a pastry of some kind?
Right you are, Kapitan. Today, we'll be making a cake.

Fields.MenuText: I haven't done anything like this before.
I can feel my smile widening...
A cake, huh? Fancy.

Fields.DialogueText: It's all right, Kapitan! I haven't either, but those locals provided me with a nice recipe for a nice, plump layer cake. And don't you worry, Kapitan, we'll do it together!
(It's a really cute smile, too.) Mine, too, Kapitan! We've got a big layer cake to make, and I think that smile is going to help you through a lot of the initial challenge: but that's the fun of it!
It -is- fancy, isn't it? I originally thought, "Oh, we should try making that cheesecake!" But, I didn't want to spook you, and this layer cake looked really nice... Glad to see you're ready!
Well! Let's get started, huh? What's first on the ledger?
Let's see... First we have to get everything in place: Sugar, flour, coffee powder, eggs, baking powder...
Milk, butter, vanilla extract, and... salt! All right, we're good to go. So, how do we start?
First... we have to turn on the oven to about 175 and while it pre-heats we spray and prepare three eight-inch cake pans.
All right, did that... I'm surprised we have so many of these things; did the crew want cake, too?
Well, if they want cake, we should make it for them later; for now, this is for us!
Honestly, I like the fact that it is... I like the crew and all, but, Orzel, having you to do this with is wonderful.
Kapitan... I do, too. I'm sorry I've had such a hard time lately with saying that.
It's all right, Orzel. Feelings are something you come to understand slowly. I've had similar problems in my past, too.
Then... you know what I'm feeling right now?
I can only guess at that, but, I've had a hunch throughout this whole mission.
Kapitan... Have you really?
It's been on my mind since we left Stockholm.
That long? Hah... Damn it! Why am I like this?
You're you, Orzel. I wouldn't have you any other wa—Wah!
Ogh!
We... both fell to the ground this time, huh?
Yeah...
... We should take care of those Morgana.
And when we do, let's come back and bake.
Of course, Orzel.
@BATTLE
All right, and now we can...
Oh? Did you hear that? I think Krystian sounded the alarm again.
Shouldn't we have seen these Morganas from a while back? This is getting annoying.
I thought you could sense them?
I can! I'm just... distracted.
Aha... Well, let's get the rest of them out first, huh? Come on!
@BATTLE
Rgh! Please let those ingredients be safe...
I actually put them in the fridge before we went out. They should be fine.
Kaptain... You actually thought that far ahead!?

Fields.MenuText: You never know what's going to happen.
I wanted to make sure the ingredients were safe.
I want that cake.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, Kapitan...! You have no idea how happy this makes me... Thank you for doing this. And thank you for always thinking ahead and looking out for me...
Kapitan... Did this cake really mean that much to you? I wanted to bake it together, but, we could've done something else, too... (Oh, by everything my heart's throbbing...!)
Fuhahahahaha! So, the Kapitan is a bit of a glutton, huh? Ah, but... That you're this happy to make a cake that you'd protect the ingredients like that makes me so happy...
I wouldn't miss doing something like this with you for the world.
You say that... (*Sigh*)
What, Orzel? Was it something I said?
Of course it's something you said! How can you have the bravery to say all of these things!?
I don't understand what you mean. I'm speaking my mind.
And that's just it, you speak your mind, but you're speaking your mind to me, and saying how you...
I have no reason to hide anything from you, Orzel. Not at all.
Kapitan... Fuha... Neither do I, but... It's not the right time.
Not the right what?
Not the right time! Now come on, we have a cake to make!
(Not the right time, huh? Well...) Right: Flower, baking powder, soda, salt, coffee powder and you put that in a bowl...
Measurements, Kapitan?
Oh! That's right, silly me... Salt is one teaspoon... Half a teaspoon of baking powder and soda...
(Kapitan... Ah... My heart.)
Stockholm looks so pretty from here...
Sure does. How long has it been since we've been gone? A few weeks?
It seems like only yesterday you beat me in chess... How time flies, huh?
Yeah... It has. Whether that's graceful or not, I'd say we tried our best.
My, my... I wasn't expecting something like that coming out of you, Kapitan.

Fields.MenuText: I'm tired, Orzel.
Fair weather, I guess.
Who's to blame for that, I wonder?

Fields.DialogueText: Fuhahaha! You said that with such honesty, I'm not sure whether to feel bad or to pat you on the back for that performance! Even though I'm jesting, are you all right, Kapitan?
Fuhu... (*Snrk!*) I ought to slap you for saying that when it's already snowing... Are you sure the sea's not getting to you, Kapitan? Maybe you need to sit down?
Guilty as cha~rged... I'm glad that my Kapitan is so used to my words that they get more cheek for themselves. Your cheeks are a bit red, Kapitan; are you all right?
I'm up and at them, and more importantly, next to you.
Well, it is snowing; perhaps you'd like to huddle up for warmth? Although, I don't think I'd recommend that.
Why not?
Andrzej has said my boiler temperature is running high as of lately and while it is appreciated that we have more energy, he told me to "not overdo it."
Overdoing it, huh? Maybe you need to sit down some, Orzel?
Watch it, Kapitan... We're nearly to Stokcholm. I have no intention of dropping my guard now.
I suppose you shouldn't. Oh, that reminds me, I finished "Who Goes There."
You did? What did you think about it?
Sad, but an important and intriguing story. Shows how far trust can take you.
How far it can take you... I suppose I'd know about that, too.
Did you want to read it, Orzel?
No, Kapitan. Even though you told me it was a hypothetical situation before; I think I'm content in knowing that it's an important lesson.
I haven't heard you be that sure of an answer in a while! What's more... you sound less fearful than you did back then.
It's because I found something in those flames that taught me something important.
The flames? What did you find that was so important?
I'll tell you later. This time, I've picked them up myself; Morganas, dead ahead.
Good show, Orzel. Let's blast through them and get onto Stockholm!
Right away, Kapitan.
Orzel... you're holding my—
I know I am, Kapitan. I know.
@BATTLE
Huh... Looks good to me.
What are you doing down here, Kapitan?
Well, the other day you said your boiler was experiencing issues, I decided to check.
Andrzej is usually in charge of that, isn't he?
When I told him I was coming down here, he said he would be heading to the mess hall. Weird.
So have you noticed anything that might look off to you, Kapitan?

Fields.MenuText: Well it has been running a bit hot...
Pressure gauge is kind of wonky...
Do you think anything looks wrong, Orzel?

Fields.DialogueText: I-It is? It is. Forgive me, Kapitan. I had a bit of kvass for lunch and I believe its coming back to me... (Ah, but wait, Belles don't need to eat!) So, it could just be a frog in my throat...
Ah! Now that, that I've heard of. I've told Andrzej that he should stop in town and buy a new measurer. I'm sure he could install it... (But the last one he brought was heart shaped...)
Me? A little bit. I think it could use some cleaning off around the bottom. I ought to have someone come down... (Why is the gauge just bouncing like that?) Either way, I think I'm all right.
Well! (*Bom! Bom!*) If you say so, I trust you. Though, I have another question.
Of course, Kapitan, what?
That cake we made... I noticed it kind of went fast.
Oh, yes! I was very happy about that. The crew seemed to love it, too. Why do you ask, Kapitan?
Well, truth be told, I think I would've liked to have more of it. We made it for us, after all...
Ah... I'm sorry, Kapitan. I felt the crew might've wanted to taste it, too. We've kind of gone without sweets for a while.
Oh! No, Orzel, that's all right, I just wanted more... We did a really good job on it, didn't we?
When I took that first bite, my cheeks swelled... Your insistence on adding that brown sugar was wonderful.
A little bit of brown sugar never hurt anyone. But I think my favorite part about it was getting to make something with you.
Likewise, Kapitan. We had so much fun, and the way we finished it off with that glaze...
When we get off mission, what do you say we bake together more?
I'd love to, Kapitan. I'd love to do... a lot of things with you.
When I'm with you, Orzel, it's always an adventure, a show, and a time to remember. I couldn't ask for anything more... Oh, the boiler's gauge is going up again?
I-It's because a Morgana is nearby. We need to get to the bridge, immediately!
But the alarm hasn't been sounded yet-
Just come with me, Kapitan! Come on, double time it!
@BATTLE
"It was the first time in my life that I was played for a fool, and I frankly confess that I was fooled that time to the queen’s taste..." What an ending to that.
I told you that you'd like that chapter.
That I did... Oh, Kapitan. Look at that sunrise! That's a sight for sore eyes... I wish I could take some pictures.
After we dock, I'd like to get a few of the skyline...
Goodness, it's been such a long since I've seen... Eh? Are those...?
Morganas? This far up into the canal? They look like they're headed for Stockholm itself...
Hmm... (*Glance*)
(*Wink.*)
Checkmate.
@BATTLE
Fuhahahaha! What a welcome wagon! We caught them completely off guard!

Fields.MenuText: A little fanfare before docking is always nice.
Half of them didn't even turn around...
Unlike Sherlock, we arrived early.

Fields.DialogueText: Isn't it? I could hear some of the citizens cheering us on as well. I could get used to that very quickly if it kept on happening. Although, nothing beats being in the action with you.
I know, right? Poor form. They should've at least danced with us. It was quite rude of them to not give us any attention until they were sinking... Not like you, Kapitan, you had your eyes on me!

And because we did, we kept our promises, and the treasure of this lovely sunrise is ours. I may be no gentelman thief, but I am a lady of class... with a classy Kaptain to boot. Wonderful all around!
It's good to be back... I (*Yawn*)
Goodness me, Kapitan. You look so tired. Hold on, let me help you up...
Thank you, Orzel.
Kapitan. We've received a transmission from Rear Admiral Jarl; he is most pleased at our work and would like to debrief us.
Could you do the talking this time, Orzel? I promise I'll give some... output.
If you stay awake through that meeting, we can just come back here and rest.
I'd like that very much... Well, let's go, Orzel.
Right with you, Kapitan!
... All right. Iwo, Andrzej, are you both ready?
Yessir. I've got everything packed in a crate and I've made sure everybody will be lodging in the nearby hotel.
We've got the weekend until we head back... They've earned some alone time!
I just hope they finally get to say what I think they will.
Here's hoping. All right, get everything ready for tomorrow, and make sure the Kapitan and Orzel aren't bothered for today when they come back.
Roger that. And... thanks for putting this all together, old man.
Old man? Hah! I'm barely in my thirties... But it's my pleasure, Iwo, Andrzej.
Anytime, anywhere.
Same with me! (Miss Orzel... Good luck!)
Ah... I can't believe they left us all of this! This strawberry shortcake is excellent.
I didn't think they'd give us all of this and then head off for some R&R. From what I hear, the Marinen should be handling everything else.
We've really thinned these Morganas out, haven't we?
In no small part thanks to your quick thinking and keeping me smiling through this trip.
Fuhaha! You say it was all me, but you did a fantastic job yourself, Kapitan. Some days I ended up having to nap because my cheeks hurt so much...
That's... really cute, actually.
A-Ah! Well... It -is- the truth! You... Augh! I don't know what it is with you specifically, Kapitan, but you truly make me feel like I'm flying. Like... I can spread my wings when I'm near you.

Fields.MenuText: I'd like to be up there in the sky with you.
Being wrapped in your feathers sounds lovely.
I can't fly, but my heart is fluttering for you.

Fields.DialogueText: W-Would you now? I have to warn you, I'm really high up! If you can't keep up with me, Kapitan, I may just have to swoop in and carry you in my arms m-myself!
Careful now, Kapitan... M-My feathers are lovely, but my talons are sharp. You don't know what you're getting yourself into; what if I accidentally poke you the wrong way!?
I... (*Sigh*) Kapitain... of -course- you'd say something like that -again-. What's gotten into you? Here you are, talking to me as if we're already a coup... (G-Goodness my heart...)
Just what do you think we are, Orzel?
I can tell you were certainly more than Kapitan and Belle.
Can you now? Then why's your face so red? Why haven't you said anything yet?
Because, Orzel... I don't want to force you into something half-cocked. Just like that night, we can take it slow.
Damn it...
Orzel?
Damn it! I don't want to take it slow!
Orzel? What—Mmph!?
Mmmm... (*Smooch*)
(*Smooch*) (*Pap!*) (*Chu*) (*Pop!*) (*Gasp!*) Orzel...
Kapitan... Please... Please hold me. I'm going off of instinct.
I am, too. Orzel... Thank you.
Kapitan... I... I love you.
Orzel... I love you, too.
(*Huph!*) Now...
You're on my lap, Orze—Oh. Already this daring are you? Cuddling in my chair...
Would you have it any other way, Kapitan?
No, Orzel. I'd rather have you; I'd rather love you for you.
Then you've got me, Kapitan... Now, please; if you'd be so kind as to hold me and... could you say it again? Just so that I can hear it?
Of course, Orzel. I love you.
I love you too, Kapitan... (*Smooch!*) Hmhmhm...
